results.title: A Race of horses
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Kit Denton
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the breeding and training of racehorses in Australia. Includes scenes of foaling, breaking-in and handling the young horses, and an actual race sequence. Photographed by renown cameraman Dean Semler.

results.title: A Race against people: the story of Hong Kong's re-housing programme
results.creator_credit: Hong Kong Film Unit and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The story of Hong Kong’s Re-housing Program. The re-settlement of new migrants and other Chinese members of the community in to high-rise housing provided by the authorities at public expense. Commentary by Eamonn Andrews.

results.title: A Quiet Place in the country
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, David H. Fowler and David Sims
results.brief_description: A historic and reminiscent view of the Otawa Farm - a 500 acre house/farm located in Hawlles Bay, New Zealand, and owned by Ronald Stewart.

results.title: A Question of time
results.creator_credit: Nuffield Foundation, Judy Goodfield, Stephen Toulmin and Don Levy
results.brief_description: Treats in a new cinematic manner man’s unequal struggle to gain an intellectual grasp on the idea of time, its origin, measurement and place in theoretical physics. An exploration of the concept of time reduced to a human scale and ranging through the major historical developments; mans first notion of time; its relation to movement and more recent concepts of biological time, time in relativistic terms.

results.title: A Question of Balance
results.brief_description: This program looks at the issue of woodchipping and forestry management in Australia, with special emphasis on the South East Forest region of Victoria and NSW, and asks the question…What’s it worth to disrupt the balance? With the advent of the Greenhouse Effect it is now imperative that we look carefully and critically at how we manage our environment.

results.title: A Question of balance
results.creator_credit: ACT Schools Authority, Mat Scully and Steve Christiansen
results.brief_description: Examines the role of the arts in the education system. Emphasis is placed upon the role in which the arts helps develop self awareness, self esteem and creative ability in children.

results.title: A Question of attitude
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Stuart Glover
results.brief_description: Discusses the problem of finding work for physically handicapped people, showing many examples of successful workers in varied skilled positions. Argues that employers’ reluctance to make positions available is the main difficulty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Stuart Glover

results.title: A Queer patient
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Animation Film Studio and Pu Jia-Xiang
results.brief_description: A tale from China centred around the theme of the wolf in sheep’s clothing. A caterpillar admits herself to the animal hospital after becoming ill from eating leaves of protected plants. Unfortunately for her, this is discovered by the medical staff who decide not to let her out. However, the caterpillar metamorphoses into a butterfly and seeks to deceive the hospital staff by playing on the fact that nothing as beautiful as she could do anything destructive. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: A Queen who returned [short version]
results.brief_description: An account of the Queen Mother’s visit to Melbourne and the city’s festivities held for the event. Freatures footage of the Queen Mother at Flinder Street Station, the Exhibition Building, State Swimming Centre and her meeting with some Melbourne dignatories.

results.title: A Queen who returned [B/W]
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria, David Swift and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: On the 27th of February, Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, arrived at Essendon for a five day visit to Victoria. This film follows Her Majesty through many official functions during her visit including the State Reception, the Queen Elizabeth Stakes at Flemington, the children’s display at the Melbourne Cricket Ground and the memorable State Ball at the Melbourne Town Hall. As an introduction to the film, and as a background to this Royal Visit, we see the City of Melbourne - the old city of the past; the exciting new city of the future; its people and their preparations for the Royal Tour.
